channel.title: A-Frame
channel.description: Building Blocks for the VR Web

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 22
item.description: Tracked controllers has landed! Use the HTC Vive controllers with A-Frame. NPR has published a WebVR site, rondagdag hooked up A-Frame to
item.content:encoded:
Tracked controllers has landed! Use the HTC Vive controllers with A-Frame. NPR has published a WebVR site, rondagdag hooked up A-Frame to control a robot with Leap Motion, and we now have an initial community code of conduct!

0.3.0 is still in progress, and several members of the team will be out next week. We need to land improved embedded scene support, fix the resolution quality regression on VR mobile, implement built-in link traversal support, and refresh the homepage. We may publish an official beta build next week to hold over depending on our progress.

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 21
item.description: Where’s 0.3.0? It will take yet another week or so. A lot of work on our plates, but it will be worth the wait!
item.content:encoded: Where’s 0.3.0? It will take yet another week or so. A lot of work on our plates, but it will be worth the wait!

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 20
item.description: The A-Frame Editor is publicly underway, and the s
item.content:encoded: The A-Frame Editor is publicly underway, and the slated release target for 0.3.0 is the end of next week!

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 19
item.description: A-Frame 0.3.0 and the A-Frame Editor gearing up for release. Stand by.
item.content:encoded: A-Frame 0.3.0 and the A-Frame Editor gearing up for release. Stand by.

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 18
item.description: The Mozilla VR team got together in London with contributors, Do
item.content:encoded: The Mozilla VR team got together in London with contributors, Don McCurdy and DrawVR, who have been with A-Frame since the start. And @georational from down the street stopped by to say hi as well. There’s strong momentum heading into the second half of 2016, let’s do special things to finish off The Year of VR!

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 17
item.description: The entire Mozilla VR team, Don McCurdy, and
item.content:encoded: The entire Mozilla VR team, Don McCurdy, and DrawVR will be hacking on WebVR demos for a straight week in London. Forecast calls for a storm next week.

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 16
item.description: The future is looking bright with WebVR being incubated by W3C. Look forward to A Summer of A-Frame.
item.content:encoded: The future is looking bright with WebVR being incubated by W3C. Look forward to A Summer of A-Frame.

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 15
item.description: A-Frame intensifies as we pass 2000 GitHub stars and 800 Slack members! Sneak peeks of multiuser, embedded scenes, room-scale, a
item.content:encoded:
A-Frame intensifies as we pass 2000 GitHub stars and 800 Slack members! Sneak peeks of multiuser, embedded scenes, room-scale, asymmetric gaming, the A-Frame Editor, and link traversal at SFHTML5 WebVR meetup.

Thanks to Matt Simpson for the many contributions this week!

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 14
item.description: I have A-Dream that one day A-Frame experiences become multi-user.
item.content:encoded: I have A-Dream that one day A-Frame experiences become multi-user.

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 10
item.description: Mayo dropping shaders,
item.content:encoded: Mayo dropping shaders, AltspaceVR asking A-Frame for a dance, and SceneVR baking scenes. All vying for the crown of A Week on A-Frame, but winter is coming as Don McCurdy marches the revamped controls API.

item.title: A Week of A-Frame 9
item.description: Inspired by This Week in Servo, welcome to A Week of A-Frame! After
item.content:encoded: Inspired by This Week in Servo, welcome to A Week of A-Frame! After a hiatus in A-Frame Feature Friday, we return to our regularly scheduled programming of A-Frame awesomeness here on the A-Frame blog.

item.title: Amnesty International UK Presents "Fear of the Sky"
item.description:
Amnesty International UK in coordination with development agency Junior and the core A-Frame team recently published Fear of the Sky. Fear of the Sky transports viewers to the besieged city of Aleppo, Syria to witness the devastation of Assad’s barrel bombs. The A-Frame site features 360 photos and narration taken by activists in the field. It will be updated with new media as they are collected.

VR is often referred to as an “empathy machine”. And it is human rights organizations like Amnesty International that are in most need of empathy. With WebVR, they can reach and transport a very large audience to the aftermath.

  • Read the feature.
  • Read the press release.
item.content:encoded:
Amnesty International UK in coordination with development agency Junior and the core A-Frame team recently published Fear of the Sky. Fear of the Sky transports viewers to the besieged city of Aleppo, Syria to witness the devastation of Assad’s barrel bombs. The A-Frame site features 360 photos and narration taken by activists in the field. It will be updated with new media as they are collected.

VR is often referred to as an “empathy machine”. And it is human rights organizations like Amnesty International that are in most need of empathy. With WebVR, they can reach and transport a very large audience to the aftermath.
